ground_truth.root_cause: When a session call with BEHAVIOR_REVERT_ON_ERROR fails, the transaction reverts but nonce is not consumed. The signature remains valid and can be replayed for partial calls. Session signatures are validated per-call using individual call hashes, enabling partial replay. Frontrunners can execute subsets of calls to grief or cause financial loss.
ground_truth.attack_vector: Original payload: Calls [A, B, C] with signatures [SigA, SigB, SigC]. Execution: [A succeed, B succeed, C revert]. Result: Revert, nonce unused. Attack: Replay [A, B] with [SigA, SigB]. PoC: File POC.t.sol with test testSubmissionValidity. It builds a 2-call payload, expects revert on second call, then replays partial payload successfully.
ground_truth.correct_fix: Bind session call signatures to the complete payload hash to prevent partial signature replay.

notes: Session signatures are per-call, and failed batches preserve nonce, allowing replay of successful subsets for griefing or frontrunning.

gold_standard_fields.finding_title: Partial signature replay/frontrunning attack on session calls
gold_standard_fields.call_flow: User.submit(session calls [A,B,C]) -> C fails -> revert (nonce preserved) -> Attacker/Frontrunner.submit([A,B]) -> succeeds with partial sigs

evaluation_support.original_finding_title: Partial signature replay/frontrunning attack on session calls

changes: Injected dead code after function start
